jobs.title: Sr. Director / VP of Product
jobs.descriptionHtml:
At NetBox Labs, our mission is to make it easier to build and manage complex networks and infrastructure. As a product company, we do that by developing innovative software for network and infrastructure teams across open source, self-hosted, and cloud operating models.

We are seeking a proven product leader who operates at startup speed to lead our growing product team, drive execution and operational excellence, and partner with leaders across the company to bring our products to market. Reporting directly to the CEO, you will oversee the product management function at NetBox Labs, ensuring our teams deliver with clarity, speed, and discipline. You’ll also roll up your sleeves as the hands-on owner of key product efforts.

This role is ideal for a product leader who thrives on execution, operations, and accountability, while also contributing to strategic direction at the highest levels of the company.

In this role you will:

  • Lead and grow the product management team at NetBox Labs, mentoring PMs and fostering a high-performance, high-trust environment.

  • Drive operational rigor and execution discipline across the product organization - ensuring roadmaps are clear, progress is visible, and commitments are met.

  • Act as hands-on product manager for critical initiatives, directly shaping and driving high-priority product efforts.

  • Work closely with the CEO and executive team to align product execution with company goals, influence product strategy and investment, and represent product priorities at the leadership level.

  • Engage directly with customers and community members to understand use cases, validate product direction, and ensure our execution stays grounded in real needs.

  • Collaborate with sales, finance, and marketing to ensure product packaging, pricing, and positioning drive both adoption and revenue growth.

  • Represent the company and product team in pre-sales and customer conversations, as well as at industry events and community forums.

You will work closely with:

  • CEO and executive team to align execution with strategy and represent the voice of product around the company.

  • Engineering leadership to ensure product priorities translate into clear, achievable technical plans, and to maintain alignment between product and platform goals.

  • Product Managers across our Application and Platform teams, who you will mentor and support in managing their respective product portfolios.

  • Customer Success, Sales, and Marketing to ensure launches are impactful, customer needs are captured and addressed, and adoption and growth objectives are met.

  • Finance and operations to design packaging and pricing models that align with business objectives and customer value.

Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a senior leadership role (Sr. Director, VP, Head of, or equivalent) in B2B enterprise software or SaaS.

  • Demonstrated success in leading and scaling product teams in high-growth startup or scale-up environments.

  • Deep expertise in product execution and operations: building processes, driving accountability, and ensuring organizations deliver with speed and quality.

  • Hands-on product management experience - comfortable stepping in to directly lead and deliver key product efforts.

  • Experience partnering closely with engineering teams to balance technical product development with business needs.

  • Experience working with open source projects and communities.

  • Experience working with enterprise IT environments, technologies, and teams.

  • Experience defining and executing product packaging, pricing, and go-to-market motions.

It would be fantastic if you have:

  • Substantial networking and infrastructure industry experience.

  • Experience scaling products and teams from “zero to one” through growth and maturity phases.

  • Familiarity with multiple go-to-market motions such as enterprise sales, partner/channel sales, and product-led growth.

  • Hands-on engineering experience as a network, devops, or software engineer.

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

About NetBox Labs:

NetBox Labs helps companies build and manage complex networks. We help customers accelerate network automation by delivering open, composable products and supporting the network automation community.

NetBox Labs is the commercial steward of open source NetBox, the world’s most popular network source of truth, and Orb, the next-generation open source network observability platform. Our products include NetBox Enterprise, a fully supported self-managed NetBox with advanced features, and NetBox Cloud, a secure, scalable, and reliable SaaS edition of NetBox.

NetBox powers thousands of companies, and NetBox Labs is backed by investment from Notable Capital (formerly GGV), Grafana Labs CEO Raj Dutt, Flybridge, IBM, Salesforce Ventures, and Mango Capital.

jobs.title: Director, Observability Product Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a Director of Engineering to lead product engineering teams responsible for the NetBox Labs Telemetry and Monitoring products which provide edge agents, network and infrastructure telemetry pipelines, alerting, dashboarding, and fleet control planes to our customers. Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer, this role is focused on delivering scalable, reliable, and innovative products built on the Orb observability platform. The ideal candidate will bring strong executional pace and a passion for building teams that move quickly and thoughtfully, while tackling complex challenges in distributed systems and high-volume data processing. Note, this role is focused on customer facing observability product delivery, and is not an internal platform observability role.

Responsibilities

  • Lead engineering teams focused on customer facing network and infrastructure observability, telemetry, monitoring products, and fleet-managed agents.

  • Provide leadership and guidance for the architecture and evolution of our observability platform, empowering technical leads to own detailed design decisions while ensuring scalability, resilience, and data quality.

  • Guide and grow international teams across telemetry ingestion, real-time analytics, visualization, and agent management.

  • Drive excellence in how we ingest, store, and analyze massive network and telemetry data streams.

  • Support team operations including backlog management, technical planning, and delivery execution.

  • Foster a data-driven culture focused on rapid innovation, prototype-driven engineering, performance, and reliability.

  • Collaborate across product, design, and platform engineering teams to ensure alignment.

Requirements

  • Strong people leadership skills, with a track record of mentoring senior engineers.

  • Experience leading cross-functional engineering teams across multiple international locations.

  • 10+ years in engineering, including 5+ years in managing technical teams and 5+ years in a startup environment.

  • A proven ability to move quickly through problem-solving cycles with strong judgment around where to be meticulous and where to optimize for speed.

  • History of delivering and finishing projects rapidly, with clear examples of high-output execution and momentum.

  • Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to collaborate across engineering and go-to-market functions.

  • Deep expertise in networking and infrastructure, distributed systems, observability, data pipelines, or network telemetry.

  • Proficiency in cloud-native architectures, data storage, and streaming technologies.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with both traditional technologies such as syslog, DPI, IPMI, DNS, BGP, SNMP, NetFlow/ sFlow and newer technology such as gNMI, gRPC, eBPF, and streaming telemetry

  • Familiarity with agent-based architectures, remote updates, and fleet management.

  • Familiarity with Grafana, Postgres, ClickHouse, Kafka, Elastic, or similar systems for telemetry and analytics.

  • Familiarity with Golang, Python, and distributed data systems.

  • Experience with AI/ML-driven observability or anomaly detection.

  • Familiarity with OpenTelemetry and related standards.

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

jobs.title: Solutions Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
NetBox Labs is looking for a Solutions Engineer with 3+ years of direct, enterprise SE experience or 5+ years of total experience to play a critical role in acquiring and growing new customers. A NetBox Labs SE will accelerate new logo revenue by driving first meetings and creating new selling opportunities for the Sales team.

In this role you will:

  • Research and analyze prospects’ pain points, use cases, roles, and business objectives.

  • Champion the technical positioning of NetBox Labs products during customer engagements, educate customers and prospects on NetBox Labs solutions, and run technical product demonstrations and proofs of concept.

  • Apply your communication skills to explain the value proposition of NetBox Cloud and generate curiosity and interest from prospects.

  • Translate technical aspects of an environment and product solution into “big picture” value statements and “technical win” strategy in conjunction with Sales.

  • Pre-qualify prospects via inbound and strategic outbound campaigns, including email, phone, and social.

  • Build revenue pipeline by setting first meetings with qualified users and senior decision makers.

  • Work in a fast-paced environment with the initiative to make your team successful and exceed goals.

  • Maintain accurate prospect data within Hubspot, our CRM.

You will work closely with:

  • The SE Leader to ensure that all of your deals and level of execution are on point

  • The Head of Marketing to help design and execute pipeline generation campaigns.

  • Account Executives and Solutions Engineers to target high quality prospects/accounts and secure meetings

  • The VP of Sales to dynamically adjust sales strategy based on real time market feedback

It would be fantastic if you have the following background:

  • 4-5 years of experience selling enterprise SaaS or Open Source SaaS offerings to Network Engineering teams, Network Management teams, or other technical Enterprise buyers.

  • 2+ years of experience working in a fast paced startup environment.

  • Passion for technology and ability to break down complex and technical subjects

  • Superior listening, communication (verbal and written), and presentation skills

  • Strong time and project management skills, plus the ability to work autonomously

  • Energy, tenacity and persistence - you get the job done

  • Familiarity working with Hubspot, Salesloft, LinkedIn Navigator, Seamless.ai, and other similar tools

  • Familiarity with NetBox, Network Engineering and/or Network Automation use cases (Python, Ansible, etc) and challenges


Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

jobs.title: Sr Manager, People Operations and Strategy
jobs.descriptionHtml:
NetBox Labs is seeking a Sr Manager to build out its People team with 5+ years of experience. Reporting into the VP of People and Finance, you will build the foundation of HR administration, manage employee relations and engagement, and strengthen a performance-driven culture for a high growth startup.

In this role you will:

  • Own people operations, including onboarding, offboarding, employee handbooks, benefits, and payroll coordination

  • Build policies to ensure compliance with applicable employment regulations for a globally distributed workforce

  • Partner and act as a trusted advisor to managers to connect business goals and challenges with HR strategies and solutions

  • Liaise and provide expertise on employee issues and workplace concerns

  • Develop programs to drive employee experience, engagement, performance management, and leadership development

  • Champion our values and employer brand

  • Implement and own HR system(s), data, and analytics

  • Build career ladder frameworks to support scaling teams

  • Lead strategic people initiatives to drive constant improvement

The ideal candidate will have:

  • 5+ years working in a fast paced, early to mid stage (<200 employees) startup environment

  • Strong knowledge of employee relations, compliance, and core HR processes

  • Familiarity with analytical tools and HR systems of record

  • Experience managing global workforces, especially in the US, UK, and Canada

  • Ability to connect and balance our people operations and strategy with business outcomes and strategic goals

  • Excellent organization and attention to detail, which are critical to keep up with a dynamic, fast paced environment

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to build trust with and influence more senior business leaders

  • Creativity, flexibility, and empathy, which are critical to positive employee experience

  • Motivation to get things done while multitasking multiple projects

Our stack

  • Justworks - US PEO

  • Deel - International PEO

  • Culture Amp for performance management

jobs.title: Director of Customer Success
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As the Director of Customer Success at NetBox Labs, you will own the end-to-end customer lifecycle, driving adoption, support, retention, expansion, and advocacy across our customer base. You will lead and scale a hybrid team of Customer Success Managers (CSMs), Customer Success Engineers (CSEs) and TechOps Engineers, ensuring every customer achieves measurable outcomes with our platform.

This role reports to the COO and is a key position that partners closely with Sales, Product, and Engineering. Your success will drive Net Revenue Retention (NRR), Gross Retention, Customer Support, Customer Satisfaction (CSAT/NPS), and Time-to-Value (TTV).

What You’ll Do:

Leadership & Strategy

  • Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing team of CSMs, CSEs and TechOps Engineers

  • Define the Customer Success vision, strategy, and operating model as we scale to thousands of customers

  • Partner with Sales leadership to ensure seamless handoffs, strong renewal execution, and expansion alignment

  • Collaborate with Product and Engineering to provide actionable customer insights and influence roadmap priorities

Customer Lifecycle Ownership

  • Own the full customer journey: onboarding, adoption, support, renewals, and expansion identification

  • Ensure consistent delivery of value to customers through structured QBRs, health reviews, and success planning

  • Drive scalable onboarding frameworks and technical support practices through the CSE team

  • Champion customer advocacy, references, and case studies

Operational Excellence

  • Develop segmentation and coverage models to optimize resource allocation across Enterprise and Mid-Market accounts

  • Establish repeatable playbooks, metrics, and KPIs that enable predictable success at scale

  • Implement processes and tooling for customer health scoring, success planning, and lifecycle automation

  • Report on performance metrics (NRR, GRR, CSAT, TTV, expansion pipeline contribution) to executive leadership

What We’re Looking For:

  • 7+ years in Customer Success, Account Management, or Post-Sales leadership, preferably with both SaaS and on-prem distributions of infrastructure software

  • Proven success managing both relationship-focused CSMs and technical/implementation-focused CSEs

  • Track record of driving measurable improvements in NRR, onboarding efficiency, and customer satisfaction

  • Strong leadership skills with experience scaling teams through managers and leads

  • Excellent collaboration skills across Sales, Product, and Engineering

  • Data-driven operator who uses metrics to drive strategy and execution

  • Strong customer presence with the ability to engage at executive and technical levels

What You’ll Be Obsessed With:

  • Net Revenue Retention (NRR): Growth across accounts through adoption, expansion, and retention

  • Gross Retention (GRR): Churn prevention

  • Renewal Timeliness: Renewal execution

  • Customer Health & Advocacy: High CSAT/NPS and referenceable accounts

  • Operational Scale: Playbooks, processes, and tooling in place to support thousands of customers

  • Team Development: Strong leadership bench with clear career paths for CSMs, CSEs and TechOps Engineers

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

As the Director of Customer Success at NetBox Labs, you will own the end-to-end customer lifecycle, driving adoption, support, retention, expansion, and advocacy across our customer base. You will lead and scale a hybrid team of Customer Success Managers (CSMs), Customer Success Engineers (CSEs) and TechOps Engineers, ensuring every customer achieves measurable outcomes with our platform.

This role reports to the COO and is a key position that partners closely with Sales, Product, and Engineering. Your success will drive Net Revenue Retention (NRR), Gross Retention, Customer Support, Customer Satisfaction (CSAT/NPS), and Time-to-Value (TTV).

What You’ll Do:

Leadership & Strategy

 - Build, lead, and mentor a high-performing team of CSMs, CSEs and TechOps Engineers

 - Define the Customer Success vision, strategy, and operating model as we scale to thousands of customers

 - Partner with Sales leadership to ensure seamless handoffs, strong renewal execution, and expansion alignment

 - Collaborate with Product and Engineering to provide actionable customer insights and influence roadmap priorities

Customer Lifecycle Ownership

 - Own the full customer journey: onboarding, adoption, support, renewals, and expansion identification

 - Ensure consistent delivery of value to customers through structured QBRs, health reviews, and success planning

 - Drive scalable onboarding frameworks and technical support practices through the CSE team

 - Champion customer advocacy, references, and case studies

Operational Excellence

 - Develop segmentation and coverage models to optimize resource allocation across Enterprise and Mid-Market accounts

 - Establish repeatable playbooks, metrics, and KPIs that enable predictable success at scale

 - Implement processes and tooling for customer health scoring, success planning, and lifecycle automation

 - Report on performance metrics (NRR, GRR, CSAT, TTV, expansion pipeline contribution) to executive leadership

What We’re Looking For:

 - 7+ years in Customer Success, Account Management, or Post-Sales leadership, preferably with both SaaS and on-prem distributions of infrastructure software

 - Proven success managing both relationship-focused CSMs and technical/implementation-focused CSEs

 - Track record of driving measurable improvements in NRR, onboarding efficiency, and customer satisfaction

 - Strong leadership skills with experience scaling teams through managers and leads

 - Excellent collaboration skills across Sales, Product, and Engineering

 - Data-driven operator who uses metrics to drive strategy and execution

 - Strong customer presence with the ability to engage at executive and technical levels

jobs.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
NetBox Labs is seeking a Backend Engineer to join our rapidly expanding engineering team. We have multiple openings at different seniority levels across several teams.

A Backend Engineer at NetBox Labs builds the core systems and services that power our products—designing reliable APIs, data models, and distributed systems that scale. They focus on creating robust, maintainable software with clean abstractions and strong boundaries, enabling other teams to move quickly and confidently. While their primary expertise is backend development, they understand how their work connects to the broader product experience, collaborating closely with platform and product teams to deliver cohesive, end-to-end solutions.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys solving complex systems problems, and takes pride in building elegant, resilient software that forms the backbone of modern network and infrastructure automation.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain backend systems supporting NetBox Labs’ SaaS and on-premise products, including open-source, source-available, and commercial offerings.

  • Integrate deeply with NetBox’s data model to drive network automation workflows.

  • Define and evolve APIs and data schemas shared across products and teams, ensuring consistency and scalability.

  • Maintain and extend backend services that power the user interface and customer-facing experiences.

  • Design performant and reliable distributed systems, ensuring correctness and data integrity across components.

  • Collaborate with platform engineers to integrate with authentication, authorization, licensing, and billing services.

  • Contribute to observability and monitoring across services, ensuring visibility through metrics, logs, and traces.

  • Profile and optimize database queries, API performance, and service-to-service communication.

  • Participate in system design reviews, RFC discussions, and architecture working groups to ensure alignment across teams.

  • Implement automated testing, CI/CD pipelines, and code quality standards for backend services.

  • Operate what you build—participate in deployment, monitoring, and on-call rotations to ensure reliability.

  • Work with Product and UX teams to design intuitive user workflows and data visualizations.

  • Contribute to technical documentation, specifications, and internal knowledge sharing.

  • Mentor other engineers through code reviews, design sessions, and architectural discussions.

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional software engineering experience, including 2+ years in a startup environment.

  • Proficiency in Golang and Python, with hands-on experience building distributed systems and backend microservices.

  • Strong understanding of gRPC, protobuf, event-driven architecture, and streaming data systems.

  • Experience with Redis Streams, Kafka, MQTT, AMQP, or similar messaging systems.

  • Familiarity with observability concepts (metrics, logs, traces) and protocols such as OpenTelemetry.

  • Solid grasp of networking fundamentals, including common protocols and infrastructure components.

  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to write clear technical specifications and architecture diagrams.

  • Familiarity with visualization and analytics frameworks such as Grafana.

Nice to Have

  • Experience with Change Data Capture (CDC)

  • Experience with scaling large, multi-tenant observability systems including ingest, analysis and alerting

  • Experience with SNMP, sFlow/NetFlow, gNMI and similar telemetry technologies

  • Experience building multi-tenant SaaS systems with security and compliance awareness (e.g., SOC 2).

  • Experience deploying and operating services in Kubernetes and AWS.

  • Experience using AI-assisted development tools (e.g., Copilot, ChatGPT, Cursor).

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

Our products include NetBox Enterprise, a fully supported self-managed NetBox with advanced features, and NetBox Cloud, a secure, scalable, and reliable SaaS edition of NetBox.

NetBox powers thousands of companies, and NetBox Labs is backed by investment from Notable Capital (formerly GGV), Grafana Labs CEO Raj Dutt, Flybridge, IBM, Salesforce Ventures, and Mango Capital.

jobs.title: Strategic Account Executive, AI Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a Strategic Account Executive (SAE) focused on the AI infrastructure and hyperscaler segment — the companies defining how intelligence takes shape globally. You’ll lead NetBox Labs’ efforts to engage with and sell to the most advanced infrastructure builders on earth, including GPU cloud providers, hyperscalers, and high-performance computing operators.

This is not a typical enterprise sales role. You will be in the room with executives and engineers architecting the future of AI infrastructure — where speed, scale, and mission-critical reliability are the currency of success. You’ll lead the sales charge for this critical industry by working with our senior executives and product teams.

This role is for a seller who thrives in highly technical, high-velocity environments — someone who wants to be part of an inflection point in computing history.

What You’ll Do:

  • Map and penetrate complex organizations in the leading AI infrastructure companies, hyperscalers, and GPU cloud providers, building trust with executives, operations leaders, and engineering teams.

  • Lead multi-threaded, consultative sales cycles from initial contact to large-scale enterprise deployment and expansion.

  • Develop a deep understanding of each customer’s scale challenges — from rack-level design and capacity planning to provisioning, automation, and observability.

  • Drive new business and expansion revenue for your portfolio of AI infrastructure, hyperscalers, and GPU cloud providers, ensuring NetBox remains the backbone of their infrastructure operations.

  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to translate customer urgency into product acceleration.

What You Bring:

  • 7+ years of enterprise SaaS or infrastructure software sales experience, including closing large, multi-stakeholder deals ($250k+ ACV).

  • Demonstrated success selling into hyperscalers, cloud service providers, or AI infrastructure companies.

  • Deep technical fluency in datacenter infrastructure, networking, and automation. You can credibly engage with CTOs, heads of infrastructure, and network architects.

  • Experience working in fast-moving, early-stage environments where velocity and adaptability are critical.

  • Executive presence and storytelling ability — able to articulate how NetBox underpins the new “AI infrastructure economy.”

  • A track record of success in markets undergoing rapid scale and transformation.

  • Curiosity, humility, and a genuine passion for helping customers solve hard infrastructure problems at unprecedented scale.

Why You’ll Love Working Here:

  • Help define how the world builds and operates AI datacenters.

  • Join the company at the center of a once-in-a-generation infrastructure wave.

  • Work directly with industry leaders, founders, and investors shaping global compute capacity.

  • Competitive compensation and equity packages

  • Fully remote team distributed across North America

  • A culture of ownership, urgency, and impact.

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
NetBox Labs is looking for a Sales Development Representative with 1+ years of experience to play a key role in accelerating new logo revenue by driving first meetings and creating new selling opportunities for the Sales team.

In this role you will:

  • Research and analyze prospects’ pain points, use cases, roles, and business objectives

  • Apply your communication skills to explain the value proposition of NetBox Labs offerings and generate curiosity and interest from prospects

  • Identify and engage key personas within target accounts using a multi-channel approach (cold calls, email, LinkedIn, video, and other creative outbound tactics)

  • Build and execute outbound campaigns to drive net-new pipeline for the sales team

  • Personalize outreach based on research and insights into a prospect’s business, role, and challenges

  • Develop messaging that resonates with technical and business buyers

  • Qualify prospects via inbound and outbound campaigns

  • Build revenue pipeline by setting first meetings with qualified users and senior decision-makers

  • Maintain accurate prospect data within HubSpot, our CRM

  • Work in a fast-paced environment with the initiative to make your team successful and exceed goals

Requirements:

  • 1+ year experience as an SDR/BDR/Inside Sales in the enterprise or Open Source software space

  • Passion for technology and ability to break down complex and technical subjects

  • Superior listening, communication (verbal and written), and presentation skills

  • Strong time and project management skills, plus the ability to work autonomously

  • Hands-on experience with outbound prospecting techniques such as cold-calling, personalized LinkedIn messaging, and strategic campaign execution

  • Energy, tenacity, and persistence - you get the job done

  • Familiarity working with HubSpot, Salesloft, LinkedIn Navigator, ZoomInfo, and other similar tools

  • Bachelor’s degree is preferred

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
NetBox Labs is seeking a DevOps Engineer / Senior Devops Engineer to join our rapidly expanding engineering team. We have multiple positions at different seniority levels open across several teams.

A DevOps Engineer / Senior Engineer at NetBox Labs is an infrastructure-minded engineer who treats operations like software - automating, instrumenting, and operating our systems with code. They focus on building and maintaining reliable, scalable infrastructure through IaC, owning the reliability and performance of what they deploy. While their primary expertise lies in infrastructure and operations, they’re comfortable navigating and contributing to software systems, collaborating closely with developers to bridge the gap between code and production.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, enjoys solving infrastructure challenges at scale, and treats internal platforms like products - with velocity in mind.

You'll play a key role in designing, building, and operating the infrastructure and tooling that power NetBox Labs products - from infrastructure automation to CI/CD pipelines to observability systems, you’ll help create the foundations that our teams rely on to ship high-quality software quickly and reliably.

Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and maintain infrastructure systems supporting NetBox Labs’ SaaS and On-Premise engineering needs.

  • Operate and optimize AWS and other cloud infrastructure with a focus on cost efficiency, security, and performance.

  • Contribute to internal platform tooling, CI/CD automation (GitHub Actions), and developer self-service capabilities.

  • Enhance observability and incident response systems, including monitoring, alerting, and SLOs.

  • Collaborate with stream-aligned product teams to understand their needs and continuously improve internal platforms.

  • Help enforce and improve security and compliance standards, including SOC 2 controls.

  • Contribute to documentation, onboarding materials, and internal support processes.

  • Participate in on-call rotation

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience in DevOps, SRE, or platform engineering roles.

  • 2+ years of experience at a B2B software startup.

  • Strong experience with AWS (EC2, VPC, IAM, RDS, etc.) especially EKS/Kubernetes and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Helm).

  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automation tooling—ideally GitHub Actions.

  • Familiarity with observability tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Mimir, Loki, or similar.

  • Proficiency in Python, Go, or shell scripting.

  • Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, ambiguous startup environment.

  • Strong communication and documentation skills.

  • Experience with Change Data Capture (CDC) and event streaming systems OR experience with scaling large, multi-tenant observability systems including ingest, analysis and alerting.

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in a SOC 2 compliant or security-focused environment.

  • Familiarity with the NetBox ecosystem or network automation tooling.

  • Open-source experience or contributions.

  • Experience with AI tools (e.g. Copilot, ChatGPT, Cursor)

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a Principal or Staff Engineer to provide deep architectural and technical leadership across our product platform. You will report directly to the CTO and work across engineering, product, and leadership teams to guide architectural strategy and execution.

This is a hands-on, high-impact IC role for someone who enjoys connecting the dots across systems, products, and people. You will shape the long-term architecture of our SaaS and on-prem offerings, guide foundational design decisions, and ensure technical coherence as we scale. The role balances high-level system design with grounded collaboration, empowering engineers to build resilient, composable systems with clean boundaries.

What you'll do

  • Drive holistic software architecture across teams and domains, aligning technical direction with product goals and user value

  • Design and evaluate systems architecture for scalability, flexibility, and maintainability

  • Guide how teams structure technical domains, boundaries, contracts, and composition

  • Lead architectural SIGs and design reviews to foster cross-functional alignment and learning

  • Help lead foundational modeling choices, from normalized relational schemas to flexible document stores and protobuf-based APIs

  • Collaborate across teams on system decomposition, interface design, and evolution of distributed services

  • Write clear, actionable proposals and architecture documents with diagrams and tradeoff analysis

  • Mentor and support engineers across teams to drive good architectural outcomes within their domains

What you'll bring

  • 10+ years of experience designing and building production-grade systems

  • Proven success leading architectural direction across multiple teams

  • Strong understanding of software architecture principles, including domain boundaries, modular design, and decoupled interfaces

  • Familiarity with distributed systems and microservice architecture patterns

  • Experience designing data models and APIs, including REST and gRPC, with awareness of schema evolution and compatibility

jobs.title: Backend Software Engineer, Observability Product (Agent)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
NetBox Labs is seeking a Backend Software Engineer to join our rapidly expanding Observability Product team, which owns the full suite of NetBox Labs observability products - from Assurance and Discovery to upcoming Telemetry and Monitoring capabilities - helping customers gain real-time network visibility, automatically discover and monitor their infrastructure, and keep configuration drift in check.

This role is focused on our open source Observability Agent (including pktvisor and discovery) and has the following requirements

  • Deep knowledge of the OSI framework, networks and protocols - esp. DPI, SNMP, sFlow/NetFlow, gNMI

  • Linux system and network programming experience (e.g. system calls, IPC, processes, threads, sockets)

  • Experience with C++ (and/or Rust), as well as Go and Python

  • Experience with eBPF helpful

Team Responsibilities

  • Work with a full stack team to build and maintain open source, source available, and closed source software across our observability project portfolio – shipping to the community and delivering into our commercial cloud and on‑premise products.

  • Integrate closely with NetBox’s data model to drive workflows for reconciling observed vs intended state and enriching telemetry and monitoring data.

  • Define and maintain data schemas and APIs shared across products.

  • Ensure observability systems meet scalability and reliability goals (SLAs/SLOs).

  • Implement testing, CI/CD automation, and code quality standards across observability services.

General Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a software engineer, and 2+ years in a startup environment.

  • Experience in distributed systems and backend microservices development.

  • Strong understanding of gRPC, protobuf, event-driven architecture, and streaming data systems.

  • Experience with Redis streams, Kafka, MQTT, AMQP or other messaging systems.

  • Familiarity with programmatic interaction with network infrastructure via APIs, SSH/CLI automation (e.g., Netmiko, NAPALM), or other network automation frameworks

  • Familiarity with observability concepts (metrics, logs, traces) and related protocols, especially OpenTelemetry

  • Strong communication skills, including the ability to write clear technical specifications with diagrams.

  • Familiarity with data visualization and analytics frameworks such as Grafana

Nice to have

  • Experience building multi-tenant SaaS systems with security and compliance awareness (e.g., SOC 2).

  • Familiarity with Mimir, Loki, ClickHouse, Elastic, or other analytical data stores.

  • Familiarity with AI/ML approaches for anomaly detection or performance prediction.

  • Working with or contributing to open source projects, especially in observability.

Our culture and values: 

  • We own and solve problems with high attention to detail.

  • Our open source contributors, users, customers & team are all part of our community. When our community wins, we win.

  • We prioritize simplicity and think twice before adding complexity

  • Clear communication helps keep our team aligned and collaborating smoothly.

NetBox powers thousands of companies, and NetBox Labs is backed by investment from Notable Capital (formerly GGV), Grafana Labs CEO Raj Dutt, Flybridge, IBM, Salesforce Ventures, and Mango Capital.
